column4: Someone had me comment out a line using sudo vi /etc/resolv.conf, how do I remove the comment out, anyone know?
I used a pound, how do i delete it?
how?
what button deletes a character? Surprisingly not backspace
press I
Press Esc,
then v (visual mode)
highlight what you do not want and d
That V thing doesn't seem to work, but it doesn't seem necessary anyway
So with the full version of this program, these commands will make more sense?
Should, use vim (vi impoved), much easier and nice features. you may need to get vim cheatsheet, much help.
How do I get the improved version?
sudo apt-get install vim
My favourite: http://www.gentoo.org/doc/en/vi-guide.xml
Someone had me comment this line out with nameserver 205.171.3.65, could that have any negative effects, a bit of slow down or anything? What is the purpose of that line?
Someone had me comment this line out with nameserver 205.171.3.65, could that have any negative effects?
what nameserver are you using?
I don't know enough to answer that question
In /etc/resolv.conf, what other lines do you have (should be your router, if you have one)
Anyway, all DNS is done automaticaly in Ubuntu, so no worries, if you want to experiment a bit, mind a back up and common sens, google "public name server" to see what you can play with.
I don't trust ubuntu to do everything automatically, it already screwed up my internet once already
